intro: Limonium gobicum, commonly known as the desert sea holly, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Mediterranean and Central Asia. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to survive in dry, saline environments. It is often found growing in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Limonium gobicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its drought tolerance and visual impact.
